news.title: 2020 Global Energy Talent Index published
news.content: The fourth annual Global Energy Talent Index (GETI), shows that petrochemicals businesses are reaping the rewards of a considered approach to culture.

news.title: Houston Is Not Prepared for the Oil Bust
news.content: The Saudis are flooding the market with crude in what they portray as an attempt to undercut Russia. Meanwhile, the coronavirus is suppressing demand. Houston is poorly prepared for this one-two punch.

news.title: Analyst Predicts More Lean Times For Wisconsin Frac Sand Producers

news.title: The frac sand industry’s migration out of Wisconsin
news.content: Oil and gas companies use frac sand to help release fossil fuels from rock. Gov. Walker might be gone but under President Donald Trump, the fossil fuel industry has found new confidence and life.

news.title: More fuel companies announce rollback in diesel, kerosene prices
news.content: Fuel companies Shell and Petro Gazz announced they will rollback the prices of their diesel and kerosene products effective Tuesday, Jan. 14, 2020.

news.title: Shell announces the next tranche of the share buyback programme

news.title: Is Turkey drilling offshore Cyprus on insider data?
news.content: The Cypriot government thinks Turkey got insider info on blocks off Cyprus’ southern coast.

news.title: China changes policy on foreign oil operators
news.content: China will allow private and foreign firms to explore its domestic oil and gas resources under an interim trade deal to be signed next week with the United States

news.title: Gulf Research Program awards grants to improve safety culture in offshore oil and gas
news.content: The Gulf Research Program (GRP) of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine has announced US$7.25 million in grant awards for eight projects focused on strengthening safety culture in the offshore oil and gas industry.

news.title: Oil and gas sector to boost investment in the energy transition
news.content: Oil and gas companies’ plans to increase investment in renewable energy sources is up from 34 per cent in 2019 to 44 per cent in 2020.

news.title: BP agrees terms to sell North Sea interests to Premier Oil
news.content: BP has agreed terms to sell its interests in the Andrew area in the central UK North Sea and its non-operating interest in the Shearwater field to Premier Oil for US$625 million.

news.title: US-Iran conflict escalates, crude oil prices soar
news.content: US benchmark oil prices soared to an 8-month high after a US airstrike in Iraq killed Qassem Suleimani.

news.content: Low oil and gas prices and production surpluses have forced companies to significantly cut operational production costs to maintain profit margins

news.title: India’s petroleum demand suffered marginal fall in January 2020
news.content: Demand for diesel, which accounts for 39 per cent of the overall demand of petroleum products in the country fell 2 per cent to 6,938 TMT in January 2020.

news.content: OPEC and its allies are debating more aggressive oil output cuts than previously considered after reviewing new data

news.title: IoT Solution to Transform Oil and Gas Industry

news.content: The Internet of Things has found its way into various industries: automotive, agriculture, green energy. One of the areas that IoT is about to conquer is the oil and gas world.

news.title: Defining the oilfield service sector’s role in meeting CO₂ goals
news.content: As operators worldwide set ambitious net-zero-emissions goals, oilfield service companies have an opportunity to both play a key role in meeting these targets, and take a leadership position in shaping the path of the coming energy transition.

news.title: Shell completes sale of U.S. refinery
news.content: A subsidiary of Royal Dutch Shell has announced that it has formally closed the sale of Shell’s Martinez Refinery in California to PBF Energy, in exchange for $1.2 billion which includes the refinery and inventory.

news.title: UAE finds world’s biggest gas field since 2005

news.title: PetroRio takes stake in Brazil’s oil field, buys FPSO
news.content: Brazil’s Dommo Energia SA said it agreed to a farm out agreement with PetroRio, which will see the later take an 80 per cent stake in the Tubarão Martelo oil field, along with acquiring the field’s floating oil and gas platform type FPSO OSX-3 for $140 million.

news.title: Oil and gas companies are dead last in trust update
news.content: With their inability to meet quarterly revenue and profit targets evident, there is rising skepticism about oil and gas companies as purveyors of energy efficiency.

news.title: Historic slide in oil could cost energy industry thousands of jobs
news.content: Due to a major drop in oil prices the hundreds of thousands of workers have been left worried for their jobs.

news.content: Crude prices recouped some of their losses Tuesday, partly in response to investors’ rising skepticism about the escalating war of words between key oil exporters Saudi Arabia and Russia.

news.title: Oil market report
news.content: The IEA Oil Market Report (OMR) is one of the world's most authoritative and timely sources of data, forecasts and analysis on the global oil market – including detailed statistics and commentary on oil supply, demand, inventories, prices and refining activity, as well as oil trade for IEA and selected non-IEA countries.

news.title: Trio of oil and gas players unite to launch new ‘Coretrax’

news.title: Texas Rig Count Down 29 Week on Week

news.title: INOXCVA signs MoU with Shell for LNG distribution in India
news.content: INOX India (INOX) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Shell Energy India for partnering and developing the market for LNG supply by road from Shell's LNG Terminal in Hazira (District Surat), Gujarat.

news.title: Oil Industry Experts Say Shale Will Rise Again
news.content: The American shale industry shocked the world with its rebound after the 2014-2016 bust, setting records for output that pushed the U.S. to the top spot among oil-producing countries. A handful of experts is saying that will happen again.

news.title: SDX Energy announces gas discovery onshore Morocco
news.content: SDX Energy has announced that the BMK-1 well in Morocco has been drilled to a measured depth of 1551 m and has encountered commercial quantities of gas in both target horizons.

news.title: OPEC+ fails to reach a deal, oil price plunges
news.content: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries recommended additional production cuts of 1.5 million b/d from the beginning of next month until the end of the year, in response to the slump of oil demand due to the coronavirus outbreak

news.title: Petron’s Bataan refinery ensures ongoing supplies amid COVID-19 pandemic
news.content: Petron Corp., Mandaluyong City, Philippines, is assuring it will maintain a continuous supply of petroleum products amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak from its 180,000-b/d Bataan refinery at Limay, about 150 km southwest of Manila.

news.title: Rystad Energy: rig utilisation could fall by 18% in Southeast Asia in 2020
news.content: Southeast Asia’s rig market, which was poised for growth in 2020, is now set for decline. Several oil companies have already made significant cuts to their 2020 CAPEX budgets due to the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the ongoing price war, a Rystad Energy analysis shows.

news.title: Covid-19 and oil price slump set to hit African oil and gas projects, say Rystad Energy
news.content: Most of Africa’s top planned oil and gas projects were expecting sanctioning under an oil price assumption of between US$55 and US$60/bbl. Now, with oil prices falling to below their break-even costs, Rystad Energy expects many projects to be delayed, causing the continent’s expected liquids production to decline for most of this decade and energy-reliant state budgets to take significant hits.

news.title: US and Saudi Arabia Talk Oil Stabilization
news.content: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo revealed Wednesday that he recently spoke with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud and they agreed all countries need to work together to stabilize energy markets.

news.title: Total announces action plan to deal with low oil prices
news.content: France’s Total Chairman & CEO Patrick Pouyanné announced an immediate action plan to be implemented in light of the sharp drop in oil prices.

news.title: Oil production cuts in Western Canada are imminent
news.content: Western Canada’s oil production will need to be cut by about 11% from April, or 440,000 b/d, due to the global oversupply created by the Covid-19 virus and ongoing oil price, said Rystad Energy.

news.title: Purchase of crude oil by China from America
news.content: China’s imports of U.S. crude are expected reach a new high of about 900,000 barrels a day this month.

news.title: Stalled demand and lack of Covid-19 vaccine may delay oil price recovery above $50 until 2021
news.content: Impact of low oil price over long term

news.title: Purchase of crude oil by India at $19 a barrel
news.content: India leveraged the depressed prices and lack of demand on account of the coronavirus pandemic to make this saving and filled its existing storage capacity.

news.title: Fragile Demand for Gasoline, Keeps Pressure on Crude Oil Prices
news.content: Pressure on crude oil prices due to fragile gasoline demand

news.title: Ravva oil fields case: SC upholds foreign arbitration award in favour of Vedanta, Videocon
news.content: A bench of the apex court, headed by RF Nariman, dismissed the Centre's appeal against the foreign arbitration award that allowed Vedanta and Videocon to recover $499 million for the development of the Ravva oil and gas fields

news.title: Inexpensive, non-toxic nanofluid could be a game-changer for oil recovery
news.content: Researchers have demonstrated that an inexpensive and non-toxic nanofluid can be used to efficiently recover even heavy oil with high viscosity from reservoirs.

news.title: Oil refiners worldwide struggle with weak demand, inventory glut
news.content: Global oil refiners are cutting fuel production into the autumn because the recovery in demand from the impact of coronavirus has stalled.

news.title: EIA Sees Global Oil Market Balancing By End-2021
news.content: EIA expects inventories to continue declining in the second half of 2020 and during most of 2021, resulting in a relatively balanced market by the end of next year.

news.title: First Nations worried by suspension of oilsands environment.
news.content: Given eight options for what their primary goal is over the next six months, the biggest share of respondents, 19%, said it’s keeping production flat, while 16% said growing output and another 16% prioritized reducing debt.

news.title: Iran And Venezuela Defy U.S. Sanctions In Bilateral Oil Trade
news.content: Iran is reportedly helping Venezuela to reverse the decline of its crude oil production. Iran has sent professionals to help Venezuela repair its crumbling refineries.

news.title: Domestic crude oil production down 6.3 per cent in August
news.content: The consumption of petroleum products stood at 14.4 million tonnes in August 2020, down from 17.2 million tonnes in August 2019 in India

news.title: Oil Drops After Warnings
news.content: Oil dropped following warnings over global energy demand and the state of the U.S. economy.

news.title: Venezuela is tearing apart oil pipelines to sell as scrap metal
news.content: The Nicolas Maduro regime is willing to cannibalize the country’s crumbling energy infrastructure to pay contractors with scrap metal.

news.title: Newfoundland and Labrador premier announces new offshore exploration incentives
news.content: The Government of Newfoundland and Labrador announced the establishment of a new offshore exploration initiative to provide companies with the incentive to drill more wells in the best prospects.

news.title: CNOOC Starts Oil Production from Liaodong Bay Field
news.content: Chinese oil company CNOOC said that the Jinzhou 25-1 oilfield 6/11 area in Liaodong Bay, China, had started production.

news.title: Devon Energy to acquire WPX Energy for $2.56 billion
news.content: Devon Energy plans to acquire WPX Energy for $2.56 billion, creating one of the largest shale producers nationally with a dominant position in the Delaware Basin of West Texas.

news.title: Trump's offshore energy ban include east coast wind farms
news.content: President Donald Trump’s decision to rule out energy development along the coasts of Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas will bar not just offshore oil and gas drilling -- but coastal wind farms too.
